content.description: This fun little route climbs the steep arête on the right side of the wall via mostly large, positive holds. The first bolt is quite high off the ground, but there are jugs all the way there and a good clipping stance. Be careful of what you're pulling on, because the rock isn't quite as good as it is in other parts of Devils Head. The crux comes between the 2nd and 3rd bolts where the jugs briefly disappear.
content.location: This is the rightmost line on Cam and Eggs Wall.

content.description: Establish yourself on route with several feet of moderate difficulty before entering the crux consisting of larger moves. Rest up if needed, and continue on easier terrain. Prepare for a couple low angled tricky moves just before the anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts and an optional #2 cam for 5.10 runout.
content.location: It is on the left end of the wall, just left of a low roof.

content.description: A low, balancy crux leads to big moves on good holds. Save some energy for another tough sequence pulling over the roof and reaching up to clip the anchors.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the third route from the right at the Cam and Eggs Wall.

content.description: This is a great steep, short, sustained climb on good holds. Angle up and slightly left past an undercling flake and then back right over a small roof.
content.location: This is the second bolt line from the right on Cam and Eggs Wall.
